squidpony.squidgrid.gui

Class SGTextPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.SGTextPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SGTextPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class is a JPanel that will display a text string as a monospaced font regardless of the font's actual spacing.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SGTextPanel

        public SGTextPanel(int cellWidth,
           int cellHeight,
           int panelWidth,
           int panelHeight,
           java.awt.Font font)
        Builds a new panel with the desired traits. The size of the font will be used unless it's too large to fit, in which case it will be stepped down until the characters fit.
        Parameters:
        cellWidth - cell width in pixels.
        cellHeight - cell height in pixels.
        panelWidth - number of cells vertically..
        panelHeight - number of cells horizontally.
        font -

      • SGTextPanel

        public SGTextPanel()
        Empty constructor. One of the initialization methods must be called before this panel is used.

        public void setText(char[][] chars)
        Sets the contents of the component to reflect the two dimensional character array. Will ignore any portion of the array that is outside the bounds of the component itself. The default colors of the foreground and background will be used.

      • placeCharacter

        public void placeCharacter(int x,
                  int y,
                  char c)
        Sets one specific block to the given character. This block is not drawn immediately, refresh() must be called to update display.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to set
        y - The y coordinate to set
        c - The character to be displayed

      • placeCharacter

        public void placeCharacter(int x,
                  int y,
                  char c,
                  java.awt.Color fore,
                  java.awt.Color back)
        Sets one specific block to the given character with the given foreground and background colors. This block is not drawn immediately, refresh() must be called to update display.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate to set
        y - The y coordinate to set
        c - The character to be displayed
        fore - The foreground color
        back - The background color

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int cellWidth,
              int cellHeight,
              int panelWidth,
              int panelHeight,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Initializes the component with the supplied values. The cells will be set to the desired width and height and if the size of the font is too large, it will be shrunk until everything fits.
        Parameters:
        cellWidth - in pixels
        cellHeight - in pixels
        panelWidth - in cells
        panelHeight - in cells
        font -

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int panelWidth,
              int panelHeight,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Initializes the component with the supplied number of rows and columns. The size of the display will be adjusted to match the requested font size as closely as possible.
        Parameters:
        panelWidth - in cells
        panelHeight - in cells
        font -

      • ensureFits

        public void ensureFits(char[] characters,
              boolean whiteSpace)
        Sets the character set that will be guaranteed to fit on the next initialization of the grid. If whiteSpace is true, then every character is guaranteed to have at least one pixel between it and the edge of the cell. If false, some characters might sit against the edge of the cell, but will not be cropped.
        Parameters:
        characters -
        whiteSpace -

      • willFit

        public boolean willFit(char character)
        Test if the given character will fit in the current cell dimension using the current Font.
        Parameters:
        character -
        Returns:
        true if it will fit, false otherwise.
